sprites

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • sprites.Sprite
      • sprites.Turtle

  • public class Turtle
extends Sprite
    This class represents the main character which is controlled by the player using arrowkeys.
    Version:
    5/6/22

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class sprites.Sprite

        FACE_LEFT, FACE_RIGHT, NOTAPPLICABLE

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Turtle(double x, double y, int faceDir)
      This creates a turtle at a specified place in the coordinate grid and places it facing a certain direction.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      Checks if the turtle can move and if not it stays in place.
      void walk(int dir)
      This moves the turtle in the specified direction

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turtle

        public Turtle(double x,
              double y,
              int faceDir)
        This creates a turtle at a specified place in the coordinate grid and places it facing a certain direction.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the sprite
        y - the y-coordinate of the sprite
        facingDir - the initial direction the sprite faces when spawned

    • Method Detail

      • walk

        public void walk(int dir)
        This moves the turtle in the specified direction
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction it moves in (up: 0, right: 1, down: 2, left: 3)

      • act

        public void act()
        Checks if the turtle can move and if not it stays in place.
